output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a solid foundation in synthetic data generation techniques. You are now equipped to leverage these methods to overcome data scarcity, protect privacy, and accelerate your machine learning projects. Remember to continuously explore new techniques and adapt your approach based on the specific needs of your projects.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Intermediate Synthetic Data Generation course! This course builds upon foundational knowledge and dives deeper into practical techniques for creating synthetic datasets. We'll explore various methods, focusing on their strengths, weaknesses, and appropriate use cases. By the end of this course, you'll be able to generate high-quality synthetic data that effectively addresses data scarcity and privacy concerns.

chapters.description: This module provides an overview of synthetic data generation, its benefits, and its applications. We will discuss the different types of synthetic data and the various techniques used to generate it.

This module discusses the privacy implications of synthetic data generation. We will explore the different privacy risks associated with synthetic data and the techniques used to mitigate these risks.
This module introduces Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) and their application in synthetic data generation. We will discuss the architecture of GANs and the training process.
This module introduces Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) and their application in synthetic data generation. We will discuss the architecture of VAEs and the training process.
This module discusses the different metrics used to evaluate the quality of synthetic data. We will explore the different techniques used to assess the utility and privacy of synthetic data.

This module discusses the different applications of synthetic data. We will explore the different use cases for synthetic data and the challenges associated with using synthetic data in real-world applications.

modules.moduleTitle: Evaluation and Applications of Synthetic Data
